subject: AI & Agents
title: Neuromorphic Computing: Chips That Think Like Brains
description: A short lesson to help you apply Neuromorphic Computing: Chips That Think Like Brains.

hook.text: What if computer chips were wired like neurons instead of transistors? They'd use a fraction of the energy.

buildup.text: Neuromorphic chips use spiking neural networks that fire signals like biological neurons do.

discovery.text: Intel's Loihi chip processes certain AI tasks using 1,000 times less energy than traditional hardware.

twist.text: Programming neuromorphic chips requires entirely new software paradigms. Our current tools don't fit.

climax.text: As AI moves to edge devices, energy efficiency becomes critical. Neuromorphic designs may be the answer.

punchline.text: Copy the brain's wiring. Inherit its efficiency.

quiz.question: What advantage do neuromorphic chips offer over traditional processors?
options: Dramatically lower energy consumption for AI tasks
They are faster at all computing tasks
They use the same architecture as regular CPUs
